snippet: The incomplete records from State Supreme Court proceedings in Manhattan highlight a major pitfall in relying solely on stenographic reporters to safeguard the official record of trials.
abstract: Court administration officials at New York State Supreme Court in Manhattan say that court reporter Daniel Kochanski, who was fired after developing a drinking problem, has left behind incomplete record of at least six trials and two dozen other proceedings; missing records are creating delays and legal hurdles and highlight a major pitfall in relying solely on stenographic reporters to safeguard official trial records.
lead_paragraph: The incomplete records from State Supreme Court proceedings in Manhattan highlight a major pitfall in relying solely on stenographic reporters to safeguard the official record of trials.

headline.main: Stenographer, Fired Over Drinking Problem, Left Headaches for Appellate Courts
headline.print_headline: Stenographer, Fired Over Drinking Problem, Left Headaches for Appellate Courts
